title: Emre Can reveals Liverpool's special motivation ahead of EFL Cup semi-final with Southampton
text:
Can and his teammates are desperate to win a trophy (Photo: Liverpool FC via Getty Images) Share Get Liverpool FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Emre Can is desperate to get to Wembley again with Liverpool - to erase the painful memories of losing two cup finals. 
The German suffered defeat against Manchester City in the League Cup final last season, only to lose the Europa League final three months later to Sevilla. 
And the midfielder says two runners-up medals are the motivation to beat Southampton in their two-legged EFL Cup semi-final. 
He said: "It makes us more motivated because we know the feeling of losing in cup finals so now we want the nice feeling of winning them. 
"I hope, and I think, that we will win the next final we are in... 
“Every year I have been here we have made the League Cup semi-final. In 2015 it was Chelsea and we lost. In 2016 it was against Stoke City and we made the final but lost on penalties. Emre Can is consoled by Daniel Carrico after losing the Europa League final to Sevilla (Photo: AFP/Getty) Liverpool also had to settle for runners-up medals in last season's final (Photo: Action Images via Reuters / Paul Childs) Read More Why Liverpool outcast Mamadou Sakho is worth his £20million price tag 
“Now it is another semi-final against Southampton so it makes sense to go and win it! This is our aim, of course.” 
Liverpool go to Southampton for the second time this season, having already been held to a 0-0 draw in the Premier League. 
And the 22-year-old is happy Liverpool play the second leg at home. 
In an interview with the official Liverpool FC magazine , he went on: “I know that from our game against them this season in the Premier League, Southampton will be a very tough opponent to play. Liverpool were frustrated by Southampton in the 0-0 draw earlier this season (Photo: Clive Rose) Can takes a freekick against Plymouth on Sunday in the FA Cup, during another 0-0 draw (Photo: Reuters) Read More Liverpool stopper Loris Karius has a new girlfriend in German social media personality Pamela Reif 
“They are a really good team, a very strong side, and I think it wasn’t our best game when we drew 0-0 there. But we know we can do better and our target is to win both games and go to the final. 
“I prefer to play at home second because if you go to extra-time or penalties, it is always better to be at home with your fans behind you to help you win the game.” poll loading Who will reach the EFL Cup final? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
